item.title: RSS club makes me laugh :-) Also WSL2 max_user_watches is hilarious
item.description:
Pontifications

  • I learned about RSS Club :-) from Ton
  • I'll probably run into the WSL2 maxuserwatches problem in the future too (the blogger who blogged this is part of RSS club; I of course subscribed to the RSS feed)

item.title: True experts are authors i.e. they can write down explanations and explain it to non experts
item.description:
Pontifications

  • A true expert is also an author (not necessarily a book length author!) ---> Read 5 hurdles that distinguish authors from experts for more

item.title: Javascript and the DOM are too complicated for beginners
item.description:
Pontifications

  • I 100% agree with this Computing Education Research Blog post: Where a Notional Machine Doesnâ€™t Help: JavaScript and the DOM

item.title: Where was I on September 11, 2001?
item.description:
Pontifications

  • I was rollerblading in Stanley Park 630am before our severance meeting (Nortel laid me & dozens of folks off on Sept 10, 2001). Somebody told us about it & I dismissed it as "yet another small plane". Wrong! I remember watching plane after plane landing at YVR from Prata-man restaurant.

item.title: WSL1 runs fine from cmd.exe, the windows command line, but not from the Windows 10 GUI(tap the Windows key, type 'u' and click on Ubuntu)
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Thanks to a suggestion from @benhillis on twitter, I found out today that WSL1 runs fine from cmd.exe, the windows command line, but not from the Windows 10 GUI (tap the Windows key, type 'u' and click on Ubuntu). <-- following up from yesterday's Windows 10 build 18975 on the Fast Insider Ring on ARM64 Windows 10 Lenovo C630 broke WSL1 and I cannot install WSL2.

item.title: Windows 10 build 18975 on the Fast Insider Ring on ARM64 Windows 10 Lenovo C630 broke WSL1 and I cannot install WSL2
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Title says it all. Haven't had time to debug!

item.title: Got my Samsung Note 8 Update for August on September 6- one month delayed
item.description:
Pontifications

  • The Samsung Note 8 Security Update Delay for August 2019 is 1 month and 1 days
  • Seems to be about a one month delay every month. Sometimes two months.
  • This is all fine until you get hacked :-)

item.title: Learning ethics (the real ethics not the STV100) version should be mandatory for all starting high school
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Learning ethics, the real ethics that my son is learning in high school not the STV100 version, should be mandatory for all starting high school
  • Disclaimer: I took the first offering of STV100 at the University of Waterloo back in the 80s and though I learned lots, in retrospect, really learning ethics from the philosophy ground up to its application to technology would have been better than STV100's much more superficial treatment.

item.title: The 2 Erics are at it again with pixaver: Google Photos backups made easy, reminds me of shoeboxapp
item.description:
Pontifications

  • pixaver seems similar to recently defunct shoeboxapp but hopefully more sustainable longterm
  • go 2-smashlab-erics go :-)
